page.title: 14TOURISM IN THE DOBWALLS AREA
page.content: TOURISM HAS AN IMPORTANT PART TO PLAY IN THE LOCAL ECONOMY. MANY EARN THEIR LIVING WHOLLY OR PARTLY, DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY FROM THE TOURISTS WHO FLOCK TO THE S.W. WE HAVE A MAJOR TOURIST ATTRACTION IN THE FOREST RAILROAD PARK, WHICH INCLUDES A GALLERY OF PAINTINGS BY THORBURN. THIS IS OPEN FROM MARCH TO OCTOBER AND EMPLOYS A LOT OF YOUNG PEOPLE AND WOMEN ON A PART TIME BASIS. MANY FARMERS ALSO TAKE GUESTS. THERE ARE ALSO HOUSES KEPT AS HOLIDAY LETS AND MANY HOUSEHOLDS TAKE IN BED AND BREAKFAST GUESTS. TOURISM CAUSES US PROBLEMS WITH TRAFFIC,IT CAN TAKE 20 MINS. TO CROSS THE A38 ON A SATURDAY IN AUGUST, IT CROWDS OUR SHOPS, BUT IT ALSO KEEPS THE SHOPS, THE GARAGE AND THE PUB OPEN. WE NEED TOURISTS. WE SHOULD LEARN TO LIKE THEM AS WELL.
